responses.rationale: Reports factual information about food safety measures and cooking, but lacks explicit calming language like 'safe to eat' or 'no cause for alarm'.
Describes biosecurity steps taken by farmers; this is preparedness/capability but lacks explicit calming language or direct link to public safety.
Reports cases and spread mechanism; factual.
Reports number of birds slaughtered; factual.
Reports number of birds lost; factual.
Reports number of birds killed with a quantifier 'only', but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports location of affected farm; factual.
Reports historical data on birds slaughtered and price impact; factual.
Reports duration of the outbreak; factual.
Reports additional affected farms/birds; factual.
Describes the culling policy; factual.
Reports detection locations; factual.
Describes import rules implying safety through regulation, but lacks explicit calming keywords like 'safe'.
Lists restricted items; factual.
Reports source unknown and mentions WHO report; factual.
Describes health condition of a patient; factual.
Reports a death and symptoms; factual.
Reports potential for mutation; factual/warning.
Reports discovery of a strain; factual.
Reports company biosecurity measures; preparedness/capability without explicit public safety link or calming keywords.
Reports permit requirements; factual.
Reports existing movement controls; factual.
Advises bird owners on biosecurity; guidance, not a calming assurance about the situation.
Reminds bird owners about housing birds; advice/capability, not a calming assurance about the situation.
Reports official wasn't surprised due to surveillance; implies control but lacks explicit calming keywords or public safety link.
Contains the explicit safety assurance 'safely disposed of'.
Contains the explicit calming cue 'do not need to be worried'.
Reports location of farm within a restricted area; factual.
Reports WHO advising of first global death; factual.
Reports strain identified at a farm; factual.
Reports detection of a fourth case and quarantine; factual.
Reports first death globally; factual.
Describes how bird flu can affect humans in rare cases; factual information about risk factors.
Reports prevention zone and required biosecurity; preparedness/capability without explicit calming language.
Reports similar moves in other countries; factual.
Reports government action; factual.
Describes how bird flu circulates and spreads; factual.
Reports outbreak in Norway; factual.
Reports serotype; factual.
Reports first outbreak in Japan; factual.
Reports animals were slaughtered; factual.
Reports outbreak in South Korea; factual.
Reports human infections in China; factual.
Reports virus can be transmitted to humans; factual information about risk.
Describes spread and impact on poultry industry; factual.
Reports actions taken in response to outbreaks; factual.
Reports cases, slaughter numbers, and expert concern; factual/negative facts.
Describes transmission; factual.
Reports number of animals killed; factual.
Reports first outbreak location and affected species; factual.
This is a question, not a statement providing a calming cue.
Provides advice on how to keep oneself safe, not an explicit calming assurance about the overall situation's safety.
Reports investigation into genetic changes; factual.
Reports potential for future pandemic; factual/warning.
Contains 'does not pose a significant risk', which is a bare negation of risk, not coupled with explicit calming keywords.
Reports symptoms were mild; factual (positive fact) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports who was infected and had contact; factual.
Contains the intensified low-risk evaluation 'risk... is still negligible'.
Contains 'rare', which is a bare low-risk statement, not intensified according to Q5 rules.
Reports location of latest cases; factual.
Reports outbreak in cattle and human cases; factual.
Describes virus jumping species; factual.
Provides a definition; factual.
Reports confirmed and suspected human cases; factual.
Reports number of birds killed/slaughtered; factual.
Reports new outbreak location; factual.
Reports number of infected herds; factual.
Reports pending test results; factual.
Reports test results; factual.
Reports who is at higher risk; factual information about risk factors.
Reports surveillance shows no unusual activity; a bare positive fact without explicit calming language.
Reports historical case location and exposure; factual.
Reports previous human cases and symptoms; factual (positive fact about symptoms) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports previous human cases; factual.
Reports details of a human case; factual (positive fact about recovery) but lacks explicit calming language.
Reports securing vaccine doses; preparedness/capability without explicit calming language or direct public safety link.
Contains 'risk... is considered to be low', which is a bare low-risk statement, not intensified according to Q5 rules.
Reports no active cases; a bare positive fact without explicit calming language.
Reports no human-to-human transfers; a bare positive fact without explicit calming language.
Contains the preparedness calming cue 'to protect those most exposed' from an official source.
